Scottish Medicines Consortium (SMC) Decisions

The Scottish Medicines Consortium has advised (September 2009) that Glucophage SR is accepted for restricted use within NHS Scotland for the treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus in adult patients who are intolerant of standard-release metformin, and in whom the prolonged-release tablet allows the use of a dose of metformin not previously tolerated, or in patients for whom a once daily preparation offers a clinically significant benefit.
